meanings.definition: To shorten (a sail) by taking in a reef.
meanings.sent1: The sailor reefed the sail to make it smaller.
meanings.sent2: They reefed the sail to adjust to the strong wind.
meanings.sent3: When the sail was reefed, the boat moved smoothly through the water.
meanings.sent4: She reefed the sail like folding a paper airplane.
meanings.sent5: The act of reefing the sail required strength and precision.

meanings.definition: A portion of a sail rolled and tied down to reduce the area exposed to the wind.
meanings.sent1: The sailor secured the reefed portion of the sail.
meanings.sent2: The reefed area of the sail flapped in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The colorful reefed part of the sail looked like a giant ribbon.
meanings.sent4: The boat glided smoothly with the reefed sail catching the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The reefed section of the sail helped control the speed of the boat.
